result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward Rodriguez Montanez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.
Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.  Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Waukesha Police Department.

Straight Time.
Apply 75 days sentence credit.
TIME SERVED.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Case 16CF is dismissed and read in.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward Rodriguez Montanez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Edward Rodriguez Montanez in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty of count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Count 1 dismissed as a read in.



Court orders the following:
75 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
75 Days Credit.
Time Served.

16 Months DL Revocation.
16 Months IGNITION INTERLOCK.

Costs:  $1,229
DNA Surcharge:  $200
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to City of Waukesha Police Department.
Apply Bail From 16CF246 then apply balance to 15CM2211.


Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.

Edward M Bremberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Edward Rodriguez Montanez in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Edward Rodriguez Montanez in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Hearing scheduled for September 29, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Edward  Rodriguez Montanez in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests another further proceeding in 30 days since defendant has a new case and he requested additional discovery. 
Defense requests to either hold bail motion in abeyance or allow him to withdraw it for reasons stated on the record. Court hold bail motion in abeyance.  Hearing scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Edward  Rodriguez Montanez in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez by Atty. McMurray.  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2016 at 11:00 am.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Edward  Rodriguez Montanez in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   
  Hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Edward  Rodriguez Montanez in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   
Defendant has picked up a new case 16CF246.

State filed an amended compliant on 02/12/16 adding count 2.
Court reads the new charge.
Defense enters a Not Guilty to the new charge.
  Hearing scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed and registered.

Defendant Edward Rodriguez Montanez in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.
